title: Mindset & Resilience
description: Explore how your attitudes and outlooks influence each other.

questions.text: When facing obstacles, my mindset is usually...
choices: There's always a way through
This is a chance to learn something
I need to take it one step at a time
It's hard but I'll get through it

therapeutic.rationale: Obstacle mindsets reveal resilience patterns. Way-finders see solutions; learners see growth; step-takers manage overwhelm; perseverers see endurance. All are healthy approaches that can complement each other.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different mindsets can support each other. The way-finder can inspire the perseverer; the step-taker can ground the way-finder.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched mindsets create aligned approach to obstacles.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your typical mindset when facing obstacles? How does it help or hinder you?

questions.text: When I'm feeling negative or down, what helps most is...
choices: Talking it out with you
Physical activity or getting outside
Time alone to reset
Focusing on what I'm grateful for

therapeutic.rationale: Mood recovery strategies vary. Talkers need connection; movement-seekers need physical release; alone-time seekers need solitude; gratitude-focusers need perspective. Knowing what helps your partner shift allows targeted support.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different recovery strategies require flexibility. What helps you may not help your partner. Ask what they need.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched recovery strategies make supporting each other through low moods intuitive.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What helps you when you're feeling negative? Does your partner know this about you?

questions.text: You positively influence my mindset by...
choices: Helping me see the bigger picture
Grounding me when I'm spiraling
Believing in me when I don't
Bringing lightness and humor

therapeutic.rationale: Partner influence on mindset reveals how you help each other. Perspective-givers widen view; grounders provide stability; believers provide faith; humor-bringers provide levity. Knowing your role helps you play it well.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different influences are all valuable. You each contribute unique gifts to each other's mindset.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched appreciation shows you value similar contributions to each other's wellbeing.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How does your partner positively influence your mindset? Have you told them?

questions.text: I believe most things in life...
choices: Can be improved with effort
Happen for a reason
Are what you make of them
Balance out over time

therapeutic.rationale: Life philosophies shape how we approach everything. Improvers believe in agency; reason-seekers find meaning; makers emphasize creation; balancers trust time. Understanding your partner's philosophy helps you understand their reactions.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different life philosophies can complement each other. The improver and the balancer can teach each other.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared philosophy creates aligned worldview and approach to life.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your philosophy about life? How does it shape how you approach challenges?

questions.text: I believe couples are more resilient when they...
choices: Face challenges as a united team
Balance each other's perspectives
Create safety to be honest about struggles
Remember what matters most to them

therapeutic.rationale: Beliefs about couple resilience reveal what you trust. Team-facers trust partnership; balancers trust complementarity; safety-creators trust honesty; priority-rememberers trust values. All contribute to couple resilience.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: All these factors contribute to resilience. Your different emphases can strengthen your partnership.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared resilience philosophy creates aligned approach to facing life together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What makes couples resilient? How are you building that in your relationship?
